revised_title: Freeze-Etching Studies on Muscle: Applications and Advancements in Electron Microscopy
tldr: This article explores the use of the freeze-etching technique in electron microscopy to study muscle structure. The technique provides detailed three-dimensional views of striated muscle and reveals new information about cell membranes and internal cellular details. The authors demonstrate the technique's potential for quantitative analysis of membrane surface features and its applications in various biological materials.
